Question: Let’s say blood pressure (BP) measurements are more likely to be missing among young people, who generally have lower blood pressure. You use mean imputation to train your model. Which option correctly characterizes the mean BP (after imputation) in your training dataset?
Answer: It is lower than the true mean
It is higher than the true mean
It is the same as the true mean
Correct: It is higher than the true mean
